**âš™ï¸ Ã‰quipes d'opÃ©rations techniques** : IngÃ©nieurs DevOps et administrateurs systÃ¨me ayant besoin de mettre en Å“uvre des systÃ¨mes de rÃ©servation pour l'allocation de ressources internes (serveurs, Ã©quipements, salles de rÃ©union).

## âš™ï¸ **Comment Ã§a fonctionne**

### **ðŸ”„ Flux de rÃ©servation (Ã‰tape par Ã©tape)**

### **ðŸ•’ Flux de l'API de disponibilitÃ©**

## ðŸ› ï¸ **Guide de dÃ©marrage rapide**

### **PrÃ©requis**
- Instance n8n (cloud ou auto-hÃ©bergÃ©e)

### **Guide de configuration simple**

#### **Ã‰tape 1 : Importer le flux de travail** â¬‡ï¸
1. TÃ©lÃ©chargez le fichier `smart-booking-system.json`
2. Dans votre instance n8n : **Flux de travail** â†’ **Importer depuis un fichier**

#### **Ã‰tape 2 : Configurer les identifiants Google Calendar** ðŸ”‘

2. **Configurer les identifiants n8n :**
   - Dans n8n : **Identifiants** â†’ **Ajouter un identifiant** â†’ **API Google Calendar OAuth2**

3. **Mettre Ã  jour les nÅ“uds de flux de travail :**
   - Trouvez les nÅ“uds : `CrÃ©er un Ã©vÃ©nement de calendrier`, `VÃ©rifier la disponibilitÃ© du calendrier`, etc.
   - SÃ©lectionnez votre identifiant Google Calendar dans chaque nÅ“ud

#### **Ã‰tape 3 : Configurer vos calendriers** ðŸ“…
1. **Calendrier principal de rÃ©servation :**
   - CrÃ©ez un calendrier Google dÃ©diÃ© pour les rÃ©servations

   - Remplacez `YOUR_BOOKING_CALENDAR_ID@group.calendar.google.com` dans ces nÅ“uds :
     - `CrÃ©er un Ã©vÃ©nement de calendrier`
     - `VÃ©rifier la disponibilitÃ© du calendrier - Principal`
     - `VÃ©rifier la disponibilitÃ© du calendrier`

2. **Calendrier des jours fÃ©riÃ©s (optionnel) :**
   - Ajoutez le calendrier des jours fÃ©riÃ©s de votre pays Ã  Google Calendar
   - Trouvez l'ID du calendrier (par exemple, `en.usa#holiday@group.v.calendar.google.com`)
   - Mettez Ã  jour les nÅ“uds `VÃ©rifier la disponibilitÃ© du calendrier - jour fÃ©riÃ© public` et `VÃ©rifier le calendrier des jours fÃ©riÃ©s`

#### **Ã‰tape 4 : Personnaliser les heures d'ouverture** â°
1. **Trouvez le nÅ“ud ConfigTimeSlots**
2. **Modifiez le tableau des crÃ©neaux horaires :**

```javascript
[
  { "time": "09:30", "display": "9h30 - 10h30", "available": true },

  { "time": "14:30", "display": "14h30 - 15h30", "available": true },
  { "time": "15:30", "display": "15h30 - 16h30", "available": true },
  { "time": "16:30", "display": "16h30 - 17h30", "available": true },
  { "time": "17:30", "display": "17h30 - 18h30", "available": true },
  { "time": "20:30", "display": "20h30 - 21h30", "available": true }
]
```

#### **Ã‰tape 5 : Activer et tester** ðŸš€
1. **Activez le flux de travail :** Basculez l'interrupteur **Actif** du flux de travail
2. **Obtenez vos URL de webhook :**

3. **Testez avec des requÃªtes d'exemple :**

#### **Ã‰tape 6 : IntÃ©grer avec votre frontend** ðŸ’»
- Utilisez les URL de webhook dans votre formulaire de rÃ©servation
- GÃ©rez les rÃ©ponses JSON pour les Ã©tats de succÃ¨s/erreur
- Affichez les crÃ©neaux horaires disponibles Ã  partir de l'API de disponibilitÃ©

**ðŸŽ‰ Vous Ãªtes prÃªt Ã  commencer Ã  prendre des rÃ©servations !**

## ðŸ“‹ **Documentation de l'API**

### **ðŸ“¤ API de crÃ©ation de rÃ©servation**

**Point de terminaison :** `POST /webhook/make-booking`

**Corps de la requÃªte :**
```json
{
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john@example.com",
  "phone": "+1234567890", 
  "date": "2024-03-15",
  "time": "14:30",
  "source": "Formulaire du site Web"
}
```

**RÃ©ponse de succÃ¨s (200) :**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "RÃ©servation confirmÃ©e avec succÃ¨s !",
  "bookingDetails": {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "phone": "+1234567890",
    "date": "2024-03-15", 
    "time": "14:30",
    "eventId": "abc123def456",
    "eventLink": "https://calendar.google.com/event?eid=...",
    "calendarEvent": { /* Objet d'Ã©vÃ©nement de calendrier complet */ }
  },
  "confirmationMessage": "Bonjour John Doe, votre rÃ©servation a Ã©tÃ© confirmÃ©e pour le 15 mars 2024 Ã  14h30. Vous recevrez une invitation au calendrier sous peu."
}
```

**RÃ©ponse d'erreur (400) :**
```json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Format d'email invalide",
  "message": "La demande de rÃ©servation a Ã©chouÃ© Ã  la validation",
  "details": { /* Contexte d'erreur */ }
}
```

### **ðŸ“… API de vÃ©rification de disponibilitÃ©**

**Point de terminaison :** `POST /webhook/check-booking-date`

**Corps de la requÃªte :**
```json
{
  "date": "2024-03-15"
}
```

**RÃ©ponse de succÃ¨s (200) :**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "isWorkingDay": true,
  "isWeekend": false,
  "holidayName": "",
  "availableSlots": [
    {
      "time": "09:30",
      "display": "9h30 - 10h30", 
      "available": true
    },
    {
      "time": "10:30",
      "display": "10h30 - 11h30", 
      "available": false,
      "status": "rÃ©servÃ©"
    }
  ],
  "totalConflicts": 3
}
```

---

## ðŸŽ›ï¸ **Guide de personnalisation**

### **Configuration des heures d'ouverture**
Modifiez le nÅ“ud `ConfigTimeSlots` pour modifier les heures de rÃ©servation disponibles :

```javascript

  { time: '09:00', display: '9h00 - 10h00', available: true },
  { time: '10:00', display: '10h00 - 11h00', available: true },
  // Pause dÃ©jeuner automatiquement exclue
  { time: '14:00', display: '14h00 - 15h00', available: true },
  // Personnalisez selon vos besoins...
];
```

### **Ajustement du fuseau horaire**
Modifiez le nÅ“ud `VÃ©rification des heures d'ouverture` :

```javascript
// Changez de Malaisie (UTC+8) Ã  votre fuseau horaire
const timezone = 'America/New_York'; // UTC-5
const timezoneOffset = '-05:00';
```

### **Calendrier des jours fÃ©riÃ©s**
Mettez Ã  jour l'ID du calendrier dans les nÅ“uds de vÃ©rification des jours fÃ©riÃ©s :

```javascript

"value": "en.usa#holiday@group.v.calendar.google.com"
```

### **RÃ¨gles commerciales**
Personnalisez la validation dans le nÅ“ud `VÃ©rification des heures d'ouverture` :

```javascript
// Heures d'ouverture : Lun-Ven, 9h-18h (exemple)

// Supprimez les pauses dÃ©jeuner si non nÃ©cessaires

```

---

parameters.content:
## Handle validation 
1. name + email validation
2. phone validation
3. date time validation

## Handle validation 
1. datetime is weekend 
2. datetime is non-business hours 
3. datetime is lunch or dinner hours

## Handle validation 
1. datetime is conflicting with  another event
2. datetime is a malaysian public holiday

## Checking datetime  
1. Malaysian public holiday
2. Event booking conflict

## Checking datetime  
1. is a weekend working day?
2. is a non-business hours?
3. is a lunch or dinner hours?

## Checking input received
1. is a valid name, email?
2. is a valid phone number?
3. is a valid date time?

## Endpoint for making a booking
Receives the input name,email,phone and datetime for booking

## Create a Booking :  MAKE A BOOKING ENDPOINT

### Purpose 
This workflow provides a webhook API endpoint that your frontend can easily integrate typically triggered by a submit button on a booking form.
When the frontend calls this REST API, the workflow handles the booking logic by performing several key checks:
- Valid Input â€” Ensures all required fields are present and correctly formatted.
- Date & Time Validation â€” Confirms the requested slot falls within business hours, excludes lunch/dinner breaks, and respects public holidays.
- Conflict Detection â€” Checks for any existing bookings at the requested time to prevent overlaps.
- Calendar Integration â€” Once all checks pass, the workflow automatically creates a booking entry in your Google Calendar, keeping everything synced and visible.

### Examples
![Alt Text](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/59a519ce4ebbaf58e4173c0914dce3ec617c44f8/demo-makebooking.gif)


### How to integrate
1. Connect your frontend interface to this api below. You may  change the base endpoint to `webhook` or `webhook-test` depending on your environment.

You can also change the based the endpoint 'https://n8n.io' to your own hosted domain like 'https://mycustomdomain.io/'

```
curl -X POST 'https://n8n.io/webhook-test/suarify-make-booking' 
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '
 {
    "name":"John Doe",
    "email":"john@example.com",
    "phone":"+60123456789",
    "date":"2025-09-17",
    "time":"14:30",
    "source":"Booking System"
}' 
```

2. You will see a sample output response:


```
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Booking confirmed successfully!",
    "bookingDetails": {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "phone": "+60123456789",
        "date": "2025-09-17",
        "time": "14:30",
        "eventId": "1sin1h9cp7dh779g3s4c15dbqo",
        "eventLink": "https://www.google.com/calendar/event?eid=MXNbjFoOWNwN2RoNzc5ZzNzNGMxNWRicW8gZGI5OGJiMjhiNzcxNjU4ZjE3YzQzNzE2MzY2MGI2NzcyMTYzZThhYWE5NWIwMDI1OWMxZDFkNDA4M2YwNThjNkBn",
        "calendarEvent": { }
    },
    "confirmationMessage": "Hi John Doe, your booking has been confirmed for 2025-09-17 at 14:30 Malaysia time. You will receive a calendar invitation shortly."
}
```

## Get Booking Slots :  FETCH BOOKING SLOTS ENDPOINT

### Purpose 
This workflow powers a REST API endpoint designed to respond when a user interacts with the frontend booking form and selects a specific date.

Upon receiving the request, the endpoint returns a list of available time slots that can be booked. If the selected slot is already occupied, the system will mark the slot accordingly.
In cases where no slots for the entire day such as during public holidays, weekends, or scheduled closures â€” the response will clearly indicate that bookings are not possible on that day.



### Examples
![Alt Text](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/59a519ce4ebbaf58e4173c0914dce3ec617c44f8/demo-timeslot.gif)


### How to integrate
1. Connect your frontend interface to this api below. You may  change the base endpoint to `webhook` or `webhook-test` depending on your environment.

You can also change the based the endpoint 'https://n8n.io' to your own hosted domain like 'https://mycustomdomain.io/'

```
curl -X POST 'https://n8n.io/webhook-test/suarify-check-booking-date' 
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '
{
   date: "2025-09-18"
}' 
```

2. You will see a sample output response:


```
{
    "success": true,
    "isWorkingDay": true,
    "isWeekend": false,
    "holidayName": "",
    "holidayMessage": "",
    "weekendMessage": "",
    "availableSlots": [
        {
            "time": "09:30",
            "display": "9:30 AM - 10:30 AM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        },
        {
            "time": "10:30",
            "display": "10:30 AM - 11:30 AM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        },
        {
            "time": "11:30",
            "display": "11:30 AM - 12:30 PM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        },
        {
            "time": "11:30",
            "display": "12:30 AM - 2:30 PM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        },
        {
            "time": "14:30",
            "display": "2:30 PM - 3:30 PM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        },
        {
            "time": "15:30",
            "display": "3:30 PM - 4:30 PM",
            "available": true
        },
        {
            "time": "16:30",
            "display": "4:30 PM - 5:30 PM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        },
        {
            "time": "17:30",
            "display": "5:30 PM - 6:30 PM",
            "available": true
        },
        {
            "time": "17:30",
            "display": "6:30 PM - 8:30 PM",
            "available": false
        },
        {
            "time": "20:30",
            "display": "8:30 PM - 9:30 PM",
            "available": false,
            "status": "booked"
        }
    ],
    "dateInfo": {
        "success": true,
        "error": null,
        "checkData": {
            "date": "2025-09-18",
            "timestamp": "2025-09-16T06:58:56.210Z"
        },
        "parsedDate": {
            "year": 2025,
            "month": 9,
            "day": 18,
            "dayOfWeek": 4,
            "dayName": "Thursday",
            "isWeekend": false
        }
    },
    "holidayEvents": [],
    "calendarEvents": [  ],
    "totalConflicts": 6
}
```

## Endpoint for getting booking slots by specific date
Receives the timeslots for booking

## Demo

 
![Demo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/main/full-demo-makebooking.gif)

* [frontend code example](https://github.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/blob/gh-pages/index.html/)
* [try yourself](https://dragonjump.github.io/suarify-booking/)

## Set up steps

1. **Google Cloud Project and Vertex AI API**:
   - Create a Google Cloud project.
   - Enable the Vertex AI API for your project. 

2. **Google Calendar**:
   - Follow setup link [n8n-google-calendar-setup](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/)
   - Follow capability link [n8n-google-calendar-capability](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlecalendar/)


3. **Setting up Google Calendar**:
   - Add the public holiday calendar that you want in your calendar. (eg public holiday malaysia)
   - Create a new booking-specific calendar. (eg. suarify-booking-calendar)
   - In the current node for calendar, ensure you setup the same too

 
![Setup Calendar](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/main/calendar-setup.png)

4. **Changing business hours**:
   - Change the param in node `ConfigTimeSlots`

## Workflow snapshots

Some last tested snapshots in n8n


![2](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/main/working-evidence2.png)

![1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dragonjump/suarify-booking/main/working-evidence3.png?raw=true)

user.bio: I embarked on my coding journey at the age of 13, driven by a deep passion for AI, automation, and engineering. Over the years, I've taken on various roles including Developer, Engineer, Senior Engineer, Architect, Principal Engineer, Freelance Consultant, and Head of Engineering.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
